Technical Assistance Report 
Project Number: 49309-001 
Project Preparatory Technical Assistance (PPTA) 
November 2016 
 
 
People’s Republic of China: Hubei Yichang 
Comprehensive Elderly Care Demonstration Project 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
This  document  is  being  disclosed  to  the  public  in  accordance  with  ADB's  Public 
Communications Policy 2011. 
The views expressed herein are those of the consultant and do not necessarily represent those of ADB’s 
members, Board of Directors, Management, or staff, and may be preliminary in nature.

PROJECT PREPARATORY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
A.  Justification 
1.  The  project  preparatory  technical  assistance  (PPTA)  is  required  to  prepare  an 
investment project for possible funding by the Asian Development Bank (ADB) to support the 
development  of  elderly  care  (EC)  services  in  Yichang,  Hubei  Province,  the  People's 
Republic of China (PRC).  
 
B.  Major Outputs and Activities 
2.   The  PPTA  will  carry  out  a  detailed  situation  and  gap  analysis  on  elderly  care 
systems (ECS) and services in the proposed subproject areas and at the municipal level. 
Based on the analysis and the participatory process described below, the PPTA will develop 
an  appropriate  project  design,  including  rationale;  description  of  outputs;  financing  and 
investment  plan;  detailed  costing,  procurement  plan,  consultant  selection,  and 
implementation arrangements; safeguards due diligence and mitigation measures; risk and 
mitigation measures; legal assurances required; and a design and monitoring framework. 
Technical  reports  will  be  produced  in  line  with  the  terms  of  reference  of  the  PPTA 
consultants.  The  PPTA  will  develop  a  project  administration  manual  a  development 
coordination  matrix,  a  financial  and  economic  analysis,  financial  management  and 
procurement risk assessment of the executing agency and implementing agencies, detailed 
project costing, a gender plan, an environmental impact assessment and environmental 
management plan, conceptual designs of the EC facilities, a poverty and social analysis, a 
summary poverty reduction and social strategy, and a risk assessment and management 
plan.  
 
3.  The PPTA consultants will work closely with, and report to, designated focal points of 
the executing and implementing agencies, and the project leading group. The stakeholders  
in the EC sector will be consulted.  Stakeholder workshops will be organized (i) at the 
beginning of PPTA implementation to gather initial inputs for the work to be carried out, and 
(ii) towards the midterm to report on work accomplished and agree on the project design and 
monitoring framework. Surveys will be organized as required. Focus group discussions and 
interviews will be organized including elderly, service providers, civil society organizations, 
and public and private sector.

C.  Cost Estimate and Proposed Financing Arrangement  
5.  The PPTA is estimated to cost $500,000 equivalent, which will be financed on a grant 
basis by ADB's Technical Assistance Special Fund (TASF-other sources). The government 
will provide counterpart support in the form of counterpart staff, office accommodation, office 
supplies,  secretarial  and  translation  assistance,  domestic  transportation,  communication

D.  Consulting Services 
6.  The    consulting  services  will  be  engaged  by  ADB  in  accordance  with  ADB’s 
Guidelines on the Use of Consultants (2013, as amended from time to time) to ensure 
immediate mobilization and facilitate project scoping. The PPTA will be conducted using 
individual consultants and a consulting firm. ADB will select and engage a consulting firm 
based on the quality of the proposal (80%) and the cost (20%) of the services to be provided 
(the  quality-  and  cost-based  selection  method)  using  the  simplified  technical  proposal 
procedure. A total of 42.5 person-months of consulting services (9.5 international and 33 
national) are required.

7.  Senior  project  development  specialists  (international,  4  person-months  [team 
leader]; national, 4 person-months). Proven project management experience in ADB project 
preparation is required. A university or postgraduate degree in engineering or economics is 
preferred.  Experience in elderly care or health or a social project is required. The team 
leader will lead the team of individual and firm consultants, review and ensure consistency in 
all required PPTA outputs of the team of consultants, and ensure design of an appropriate 
project. The consultants will conduct the procurement risk assessment.  
 
8.  Senior elderly care specialist (international, 2.5 person-months; national, 3 person-
months).  A  postgraduate  degree  in  geriatric  care  is  preferred,  with  minimum  of  10  years 
operational experience working with government and private sector, and 5 years’ experience 
in  ECS  development.  The  consultants  should  have  experience  in  the  operations  of 
institutional  care  facilities.  Deliverables  are  EC  sector  assessment,  inputs  to  functional 
planning, service specifications, and capacity building for each subproject. 
 
8.  Poverty, social, and gender specialist (national, 2 person-months). A Master’s 
degree in anthropology, development, or other relevant area is preferred, with a minimum of 
8 years’experience in conducting poverty and social assessments, preferably in EC or health 
or social sectors. Deliverables are poverty and social analysis, design, and survey and 
qualitative fieldwork, and poverty and social assessment, social plan, gender action plan, 
and summary poverty reduction and social strategy. 
 
9.  Elderly care design and development specialists (international, 2 person-months; 
national, 2 person-months). A postgraduate degree in architecture with experience in the 
design of EC facilities is required, with a minimum of 10 years of experience working with 
government and private sector. S/he will guide the design institutes in design of the facilities, 
including integrating green building requirements. Deliverables are a design assessment 
report covering all subprojects. 
 
10.  Financial  specialist  (national,  2  person-months).  A professional  qualification  in 
public sector accounting and finance, with minimum of 10 years’ experience in public sector 
finance. Deliverables include conducting financial due diligence of the proposed project 
components in accordance with ADB’s requirements.  
 
11.  Economists (international, 1 person-month; national, 2 person-months). A Master’s 
degree or equivalent in economics, and minimum of 10 years’ experience ideally in social 
sectors such as health, education, and EC. S/he should have professional expertise in 
economic and market analysis of a project. S/he will conduct the economic analysis for each 
component and for the overall project in accordance with ADB’s Guidelines for Economic 
Analysis of Projects. 
 
12.  Involuntary resettlement specialist (national, 3 person-months). A Master’s degree 
in sociology or other relevant area, with minimum of 8 years’ experience. The consultant will 
guide the Yichang Municipal Government in the involuntary resettlement safeguard due 
diligence, and make arrangements for resettlement plan(s) implementation and monitoring, if 
necessary.  The  due  diligence  will  assess  the  need  for  a  social  and  environmental 
assessment  review  framework  for  the  revolving  fund  and  provide  inputs,  if  deemed 
necessary. 
 
13.  Environment  specialist  (national,  3  person-months).  Minimum  of  8  years’ 
experience and a postgraduate degree in environmental science or other relevant subject is

4 
 
preferred. Deliverables are initial environmental assessment of the project EC facilities, 
inputs to the other consultant assessments, and all necessary documentation. The due 
diligence will assess the need for a social and environmental assessment review framework 
as a part of the design of the revolving fund and provide inputs if found necessary. 
 
14.  Elderly care human resources development and training specialist (national, 
3 person-months).  A  Master’s  degree  in  education,  training  or  relevant  disciplines  and 
experience  in  the  EC  sector  is  preferred  with  a  minimum  of  10  years’  experience. 
Deliverables  are  assessment  of  human  resources  capacity  development  needs  and 
subcomponent design at Three Gorges College to support improved quality and coverage of 
care services. 
 
15.  Revolving fund advisor (national, 2 person-months). Experience in the EC sector is 
strongly preferred with a Master’s degree in finance, financial engineering, or a related field; 
minimum of 10 years’ experience in fund management and/or the design of innovative 
financing  mechanisms  in  social  sectors.  The  consultant  should  possess  detailed 
understanding of the fiscal and economic challenges facing cities in the PRC and of the 
enabling environment.  
 
16.  Elderly care information and communications technology platform specialist 
(national, 3 person-months). A postgraduate degree in information and communications 
(ICT) technology or other relevant discipline is preferred. The consultant should have a 
minimum of 10 years’ experience in developing ICT platforms. Deliverables are the ICT 
assessment report and design of the component on the ICT for EC. 
 
17.  Project administration specialist (national, 4 person months [deputy team leader]). 
A postgraduate degree in project administration or other relevant discipline is preferred with 
demonstrated experience in the coordination of consultants, communication with clients, and 
requirements of ADB documentation. Minimum of 5 years’ experience in PPTA or other 
similar international financial institutions’ project preparation. Deliverables are all outputs 
from the consultants under the firm in the form of inception, mid-term, and final PPTA 
reports. 
                         
E.  Implementation Arrangements 
18.  The proposed TA processing and implementation schedule is listed in Table A3.4.  
 
Table A3.4: Technical Assistance Processing and Implementation Schedule 
Major Milestones  Expected Completion Date

Contract negotiations  IV December 2016–II December 2017 
Mobilization  II January 2017 
Submit inception report   III February 2017 
Submit draft final report  IV April 2017 
Submit final report   Within 2 weeks of receiving comments on the draft final 
report from the authorities and ADB 
Physical completion  September 2017 
Financial closure  December 2017 
PPTA = project preparatory technical assistance. 
Source: Asian Development Bank estimates.
